mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Facade of catalog building from street

The two earliest buildings in the complex, the old Administration Building and the Mail Order House, are constructed of reinforced concrete and were designed by Richard E. Schmidt and Hugh Garden. ... The 400,000-square-foot (37,000 m2), eight-story Administration Building served as the company's headquarters until 1974. [work]

Forty feet north of the Administration Building is the 2,000,000-square-foot (190,000 m2) Mail Order House, also known as the Catalog House, that was the heart of Montgomery Ward's operations, completed in 1908. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Montgomery_Ward_Company_Complex [work]
